title: DeepExplainer with RGB images
body:
Hi I'm trying to use the DeepExplainer on RGB images and have been following along the front page MNIST example but am running into this issue: 

`ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-57-d09e29becc3d> in <module>()
----> 1 shap_values_1 = e.shap_values(X_test[0])
      2 

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/shap/explainers/deep/__init__.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)
    117         were chosen as "top".
    118         """
--> 119         return self.explainer.shap_values(X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)
    257                 tiled_X = [np.tile(X[l][j:j+1], (bg_data[l].shape[0],) + tuple([1 for k in range(len(X[l].shape)-1)])) for l in range(len(X))]
    258                 # we use the first sample for the current sample and the rest for the references
--> 259                 joint_input = [np.concatenate([tiled_X[l], bg_data[l]], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
    260                 # run attribution computation graph
    261                 feature_ind = model_output_ranks[j,i]

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py in <listcomp>(.0)
    257                 tiled_X = [np.tile(X[l][j:j+1], (bg_data[l].shape[0],) + tuple([1 for k in range(len(X[l].shape)-1)])) for l in range(len(X))]
    258                 # we use the first sample for the current sample and the rest for the references
--> 259                 joint_input = [np.concatenate([tiled_X[l], bg_data[l]], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
    260                 # run attribution computation graph
    261                 feature_ind = model_output_ranks[j,i]

ValueError: all the input arrays must have same number of dimensions`

I'm guessing thats because my images are RGB and am just wondering how I should format them so I can use DeepExplainer? Thanks for the great project as well!!
